## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:


```{r cars}
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)

data1 <- read_excel("FY2018_Q1_UAS_Sightings.xlsx")
data2 <- read_excel("FY2018_Q2_UAS_Sightings.xlsx")
data3 <- read_excel("FY2018_Q3_UAS_Sightings.xlsx")
data4 <- read_excel("FY2018_Q4_UAS_Sightings.xlsx")
data5 <- read_excel("FY2019_Q1_UAS_Sightings.xlsx")
data6 <- read_excel("FY2019_Q2_UAS_Sightings.xlsx")
data7 <- read_excel("FY2019_Q3_UAS_Sightings.xlsx")

dataA <- bind_rows(data1, data2)
dataB <- bind_rows(dataA, data3)
dataC <- bind_rows(dataB, data4)
dataD <- bind_rows(dataC, data5)
dataE <- bind_rows(dataD, data6)
dataF <- bind_rows(dataE, data7)

head(data1)
tail(dataF)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
